headline.main: Hammarskjold Greatly Extended U.N.'s Scope Through Leadership and Personal Initiatives?; Moscow Sought to Oust Him -- He Got Ovation When He Declined to Leave Post

abstract: USSR and Communist Chinese press rept death without comment
snippet: Dag Hjalmar Agne Carl Hammarskjold was a respected Swedish diplomat but little known to the rest of the world when, in 1953, he became Secretary General of the United Nations.
